stories.text:
My website -- http://xordle.xyz -- has just disappeared from DNS. It's been working fine for months.

My registrar is Google Domains; there's no errors reported in the DNS settings or anywhere else. But Google's own DNS query at https://dns.google/query?name=xordle.xyz returns a status code 3 -- NXDOMAIN, or no such domain.

I tried transferring to a different registrar but it can't be transferred on account of it "not existing". I tried using Google Support; they weren't helpful in the slightest.

Do I have any options aside from just getting a new domain name if it doesn't resolve itself quickly?
stories.title: Ask HN: My website just disappeared from DNS. What can I do?

stories.text:
Figuring out what features users want is difficult.

Consuma analyzes tons of similar products and tells you what features users like, dislike and want.

Its free, give it a try and let us know what insights you get :)
stories.title: Show HN: Consuma – Build the right features for your users

stories.text:
Hi HN,

as a Software-Developer, I'm looking for resources that could help to raise my understanding of UX design.

So a simple question: What helped you increase your UX skills?
stories.title: Ask HN: How did you increase your UX skills?
